newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: VSZ pulls Slovak SAX index lower.
newsitem.headline: VSZ pulls Slovak SAX index lower.

text.p: A small decline in steel maker VSZ on Friday pulled the Slovak SAX index lower in listless trading on the Bratislava Stock Exchange (BSE).
VSZ lost 10 crowns to close the week at 640, dragging the official 16-share SAX index down 1.03 points to 168.67.
Other blue chips were mostly quiet or did not trade at all on the BSE's main listed floor.
"It is quite difficult to predict a stronger trend as the market still remains uncertain and very fragile," said Dusan Sykora of ING Barings.
But he added that from a longer-term perspective shares were more likely to rise than fall further with the current low prices possibly making Slovak equities attractive to foreign investors.
The BSE listed floor matched only 577 shares on Friday, while overall volume and turnover rose to 1,915,310 shares and 1.198 billion crowns respectively, boosted by several direct trades.
